post.description: Watermark one image with another image

image-url.description: The URL or Base64 encoded Data URL for the source image. You can also upload an image file directly using multipart/form-data

watermark-url.description: The URL or Base64 encoded Data URL for the watermark image. You can also upload an image file directly using multipart/form-data

opacity.description: The opacity of the watermark (0 to 100)

format.description: The output image format, can be either png or jpg

position.description:
The position of the watermark image, possible values are:
center, top-left, top-center, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right

width.description: If set resize the resulting image to this width (in px)

height.description: If set resize the resulting image to this height (in px)

resize-mode.description:
The resize mode to use, we support 3 main resizing modes:
  • scale
    Resize to within the width and height specified while preserving aspect ratio. In this mode the width or height will be automatically adjusted to fit the aspect ratio
  • pad
    Resize to exactly the width and height specified while preserving aspect ratio and pad any space left over. Any padded space will be filled in with the 'bg-color' value
  • crop
    Resize to exactly the width and height specified while preserving aspect ratio and crop any space which fall outside the area. The cropping window is centered on the original image

bg-color.description: The image background color in hexadecimal notation (e.g. #0000ff). For PNG output the special value of 'transparent' can also be used. For JPG output the default is black (#000000)

400.description: Your API request has been rejected. Check error code for details

500.description: We messed up, sorry! Your request has caused a fatal exception

default.description: We messed up, sorry! Your request has caused an error

post.description: Render HTML content to PDF, JPG or PNG

content.description: The HTML content. This can be either a URL to load from, a file upload (multipart/form-data) or an HTML content string
examples:
TEST DOCUMENT

Hello, this is a test page...

format.description: Which format to output, available options are: PDF, PNG, JPG

page-size.description: Set the document page size, can be one of: A0 - A9, B0 - B10, Comm10E, DLE or Letter

landscape.description: Set the document to landscape orientation

zoom.description: Set the zoom factor when rendering the page (2.0 for double size, 0.5 for half size)

grayscale.description: Render the final document in grayscale

css.description: Inject custom CSS into the HTML. e.g. 'body { background-color: red;}'

image-width.description: If rendering to an image format (PNG or JPG) use this image width (in pixels)

image-height.description: If rendering to an image format (PNG or JPG) use this image height (in pixels). The default is automatic which dynamically sets the image height based on the content

delay.description: Number of seconds to wait before rendering the page (can be useful for pages with animations etc)

page-width.description: Set the PDF page width explicitly (in mm)

page-height.description: Set the PDF page height explicitly (in mm)

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds. Give up if still trying to load the HTML content after this number of seconds

header.description: The header HTML to insert into each page. The following dynamic tags are supported: {date}, {title}, {url}, {pageNumber}, {totalPages}

footer.description: The footer HTML to insert into each page. The following dynamic tags are supported: {date}, {title}, {url}, {pageNumber}, {totalPages}

The resize mode to use, we support 3 main resizing modes:
  • scale
    Resize to within the width and height specified while preserving aspect ratio. In this mode the width or height will be automatically adjusted to fit the aspect ratio
  • pad
    Resize to exactly the width and height specified while preserving aspect ratio and pad any space left over. Any padded space will be filled in with the 'bg-color' value
  • crop

bg-color.description: The image background color in hexadecimal notation (e.g. #0000ff). For PNG output the special value of 'transparent' can also be used. For JPG output the default is black (#000000)

parameters.description: If set then enable additional brute-force protection by limiting the number of attempts by the supplied value. This can be set to any unique identifier you would like to limit by, for example a hash of the users email, phone number or IP address. Requests to this API will be ignored after approximately 10 failed verification attempts

post.description: Detect bad words, swear words and profanity in a given text

content.description: The content to scan. This can be either a URL to load from, a file upload (multipart/form-data) or an HTML content string

censor-character.description: The character to use to censor out the bad words found

catalog.description:
Which catalog of bad words to use, we currently maintain two bad word catalogs:
  • strict - the largest database of bad words which includes profanity, obscenity, sexual, rude, cuss, dirty, swear and objectionable words and phrases. This catalog is suitable for environments of all ages including educational or children's content
  • obscene - like the strict catalog but does not include any mild profanities, idiomatic phrases or words which are considered formal terminology. This catalog is suitable for adult environments where certain types of bad words are considered OK

get.description: Parse, validate and get detailed user-agent information from a user agent string or from client hints

parameters.name: ua
parameters.description: The user-agent string to lookup. For client hints use the 'UA' header or the JSON data directly from 'navigator.userAgentData.brands' or 'navigator.userAgentData.getHighEntropyValues()'

examples: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 11; SM-G9980U1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/87.0.4280.101 Mobile Safari/537.36

parameters.name: ua-version
parameters.description: For client hints this corresponds to the 'UA-Full-Version' header or 'uaFullVersion' from NavigatorUAData

parameters.name: ua-platform
parameters.description: For client hints this corresponds to the 'UA-Platform' header or 'platform' from NavigatorUAData

parameters.name: ua-platform-version
parameters.description: For client hints this corresponds to the 'UA-Platform-Version' header or 'platformVersion' from NavigatorUAData

parameters.name: ua-mobile
parameters.description: For client hints this corresponds to the 'UA-Mobile' header or 'mobile' from NavigatorUAData

parameters.name: device-model
parameters.description:
For client hints this corresponds to the 'UA-Model' header or 'model' from NavigatorUAData.
You can also use this parameter to lookup a device directly by its model name, model code or hardware code, on android you can get the model name from: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Build.html#MODEL

parameters.name: device-brand
parameters.description: This parameter is only used in combination with 'device-model' when doing direct device lookups without any user-agent data. Set this to the brand or manufacturer name, this is required for accurate device detection with ambiguous model names. On android you can get the device brand from: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Build#MANUFACTURER

get.description: This API is a direct feed to our IP blocklist data

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The data format. Can be either CSV or TXT

parameters.name: include-vpn
parameters.description:
Include public VPN provider addresses, this option is only available for Tier 3 or higher accounts. Adds any IPs which are solely listed as VPN providers, IPs that are listed on multiple sensors will still be included without enabling this option.
WARNING: This adds at least an additional 8 million IP addresses to the download if not using CIDR notation

parameters.name: cidr
parameters.description: Output IPs using CIDR notation. This option should be preferred but is off by default for backwards compatibility

parameters.name: ip6
parameters.description: Output the IPv6 version of the blocklist, the default is to output IPv4 only. Note that this option enables CIDR notation too as this is the only notation currently supported for IPv6

content.description: The HTML content. This can be either a URL to load from, a file upload (multipart/form-data) or an HTML content string

output-type.description:
The level of sanitization, possible values are:
plain-text: reduce the content to plain text only (no HTML tags at all)
simple-text: allow only very basic text formatting tags like b, em, i, strong, u
basic-html: allow advanced text formatting and hyper links
basic-html-with-images: same as basic html but also allows image tags
advanced-html: same as basic html with images but also allows many more common HTML tags like table, ul, dl, pre

post.description: Browser bot can extract content, interact with keyboard and mouse events, and execute JavaScript on a website

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds. Give up if still trying to load the page after this number of seconds

delay.description: Delay in seconds to wait before capturing any page data, executing selectors or JavaScript

selector.description: Extract content from the page DOM using this selector. Commonly known as a CSS selector, you can find a good reference here

exec.description:
Execute JavaScript on the website. This parameter accepts JavaScript as either a string containing JavaScript or for sending multiple separate statements a JSON array or POST array can also be used. If a statement returns any value it will be returned in the 'exec-results' response. You can also use the following specially defined user interaction functions:

sleep(seconds); Just wait/sleep for the specified number of seconds.
click('selector'); Click on the first element matching the given selector.
focus('selector'); Focus on the first element matching the given selector.
keys('characters'); Send the specified keyboard characters. Use click() or focus() first to send keys to a specific element.
enter(); Send the Enter key.
tab(); Send the Tab key.

user-agent.description: Override the browsers default user-agent string with this one

ignore-certificate-errors.description: Ignore any TLS/SSL certificate errors and load the page anyway

400.description: Your API request has been rejected. Check error code for details

500.description: We messed up, sorry! Your request has caused a fatal exception

default.description: We messed up, sorry! Your request has caused an error

calling.description: True if the call is being made now

number-valid.description: True if this a valid phone number

type.description:
The user agent type, possible values are:
  • desktop
  • phone
  • tablet
  • wearable
  • tv
  • console
  • email
  • library
  • robot
  • unknown

browser-engine.description: If the client is a web browser which underlying browser engine does it use

browser-release.description: If the client is a web browser which year was this browser version released

os-family.description: The operating system family. The major OS families are: Android, Windows, macOS, iOS, Linux

is-mobile.description: Is this a mobile device (e.g. a phone or tablet)

is-webview.description: Is this a WebView / embedded software client

device-release.description: The year when this device model was released

device-price.description: The average device price on release in USD

device-resolution.description: The device display resolution in physical pixels (e.g. 720x1280)

device-ppi.description: The device display PPI (pixels per inch)

device-pixel-ratio.description: The device display pixel ratio (the ratio of the resolution in physical pixels to the resolution in CSS pixels)

device-width-px.description: The device display width in CSS 'px'

device-height-px.description: The device display height in CSS 'px'

valid.description: True if this is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address

provider-type.description:
The detected provider type, possible values are:
  • isp - IP belongs to an internet service provider. This includes both mobile, home and business internet providers
  • hosting - IP belongs to a hosting company. This includes website hosting, cloud computing platforms and colocation facilities
  • vpn - IP belongs to a VPN provider
  • proxy - IP belongs to a proxy service. This includes HTTP/SOCKS proxies and browser based proxies
  • university - IP belongs to a university/college/campus
  • government - IP belongs to a government department. This includes military facilities
  • commercial - IP belongs to a commercial entity such as a corporate headquarters or company office
  • unknown - could not identify the provider type

provider-domain.description: The domain name of the provider

provider-website.description: The website URL for the provider

provider-description.description: A description of the provider (usually extracted from the providers website)

is-hosting.description: True if this IP belongs to a hosting company. Note that this can still be true even if the provider type is VPN/proxy, this occurs in the case that the IP is detected as both types

is-isp.description: True if this IP belongs to an internet service provider. Note that this can still be true even if the provider type is VPN/proxy, this occurs in the case that the IP is detected as both types

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

is-vpn.description: True if this IP ia a VPN

is-proxy.description: True if this IP ia a proxy

as-country-code.description: The autonomous system (AS) ISO 2-letter country code

as-country-code3.description: The autonomous system (AS) ISO 3-letter country code

as-domains.description: Array of all the domains associated with the autonomous system (AS)

as-description.description: The autonomous system (AS) description / company name

as-age.description: The age of the autonomous system (AS) in number of years since registration

vpn-domain.description: The domain of the VPN provider (may be empty if the VPN domain is not detectable)

is-v6.description: True if this is a IPv6 address. False if IPv4

is-v4-mapped.description: True if this is a IPv4 mapped IPv6 address

is-bogon.description: True if this is a bogon IP address such as a private network, local network or reserved address

syntax-error.description: True if this address has a syntax error

domain-error.description: True if this address has a domain error (e.g. no valid mail server records)

is-freemail.description: True if this address is a free-mail address

email.description: The email address. If you have used the fix-typos option then this will be the fixed address

is-disposable.description: True if this address is a disposable, temporary or darknet related email address

typos-fixed.description: True if typos have been fixed

is-personal.description: True if this address belongs to a person. False if this is a role based address, e.g. admin@, help@, office@, etc.

lists.description: Array of objects for each DNSBL checked

list-count.description: The number of DNSBLs the host is listed on

host.description: The IP address or host name

is-listed.description: True if the host is currently black-listed

list-rating.description: The list rating [1-3] with 1 being the best rating and 3 the lowest rating

txt-record.description: The TXT record returned for this listing (only set if listed)

return-code.description: The specific return code for this listing (only set if listed)

response-time.description: The DNSBL server response time in milliseconds

number-valid.description: True if this a valid phone number

calling.description: True if the call is being made now

security-code.description: The security code generated, you can save this code to perform your own verification or you can use the Verify Security Code API

address.description: The complete address using comma-separated values

country-code.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the location

country-code3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the location

postal-code.description: The postal code for the location

address-components.description: The components which make up the address such as road, city, state, etc

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

location-type.description:
The detected location type ordered roughly from most to least precise, possible values are:
  • address - indicates a precise street address
  • street - accurate to the street level but may not point to the exact location of the house/building number
  • city - accurate to the city level, this includes villages, towns, suburbs, etc
  • postal-code - indicates a postal code area (no house or street information present)
  • railway - location is part of a rail network such as a station or railway track
  • natural - indicates a natural feature, for example a mountain peak or a waterway
  • island - location is an island or archipelago
  • administrative - indicates an administrative boundary such as a country, state or province

location-tags.description: Array of strings containing any location tags associated with the address. Tags are additional pieces of metadata about a specific location, there are thousands of different tags. Some examples of tags: shop, office, cafe, bank, pub

region-code.description: The ISO 3166-2 region code for the location

postal-address.description: The formatted address using local standards suitable for printing on an envelope

found.description: True if these coordinates map to a real location

address.description: The complete address using comma-separated values

country-code.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the location

postal-code.description: The postal code for the location

address-components.description: The components which make up the address such as road, city, state, etc

country-code3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the location

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

location-type.description:
The detected location type ordered roughly from most to least precise, possible values are:
  • address - indicates a precise street address
  • street - accurate to the street level but may not point to the exact location of the house/building number
  • city - accurate to the city level, this includes villages, towns, suburbs, etc
  • postal-code - indicates a postal code area (no house or street information present)
  • railway - location is part of a rail network such as a station or railway track
  • natural - indicates a natural feature, for example a mountain peak or a waterway
  • island - location is an island or archipelago
  • administrative - indicates an administrative boundary such as a country, state or province

location-tags.description: Array of strings containing any location tags associated with the address. Tags are additional pieces of metadata about a specific location, there are thousands of different tags. Some examples of tags: shop, office, cafe, bank, pub

region-code.description: The ISO 3166-2 region code for the location

postal-address.description: The formatted address using local standards suitable for printing on an envelope

bad-words-list.description: An array of the bad words found

bad-words-total.description: Total number of bad words detected

censored-content.description: The censored content (only set if censor-character has been set)

is-bad.description: Does the text contain bad words

verified.description: True if the code is valid

http-status-message.description: The HTTP status message assoicated with the status code

server-region.description: The servers IP geo-location: full region name (if detectable)

query.description: A key-value map of the URL query paramaters

server-name.description: The name of the server software hosting this URL

server-country.description: The servers IP geo-location: full country name

real.description: Is this URL actually serving real content

server-city.description: The servers IP geo-location: full city name (if detectable)

url.description: The fully qualified URL. This may be different to the URL requested if http-redirect is true

valid.description: Is this a valid well-formed URL

load-time.description: The time taken to load the URL content in seconds

http-ok.description: True if this URL responded with an HTTP OK (200) status

content-size.description: The size of the URL content in bytes

http-status.description: The HTTP status code this URL responded with. An HTTP status of 0 indicates a network level issue

server-country-code.description: The servers IP geo-location: ISO 2-letter country code

content-encoding.description: The encoding format the URL uses

server-ip.description: The IP address of the server hosting this URL

url-protocol.description: The URL protocol, usually http or https

http-redirect.description: True if this URL responded with an HTTP redirect

content.description: The actual content this URL responded with. Only set if the 'fetch-content' option was used

is-timeout.description: True if a timeout occurred while loading the URL. You can set the timeout with the request parameter 'timeout'

language-code.description: The ISO 2-letter language code of the page. Extracted from either the HTML document or via HTTP headers

is-error.description: True if an error occurred while loading the URL. This includes network errors, TLS errors and timeouts

id.description: The time zone ID as per the IANA time zone database (tzdata)

date.description: The current date at the time zone (ISO 8601 format 'YYYY-MM-DD')

time.description: The current time at the time zone (ISO 8601 format 'hh:mm:ss.sss')

offset.description: The UTC offset for the time zone (ISO 8601 format 'hh:mm')

id.description: The sensor ID. This is a permanent and unique ID for each sensor

blocklist.description: The primary blocklist category this sensor belongs to

description.description: Contains details about the sensor source and what type of malicious activity was detected

valid.description: Is this a valid email address (syntax and domain is valid)

verified.description: True if this address has passed SMTP verification. Check the smtp-status and smtp-response fields for specific verification details

email.description: The email address. If you have used the fix-typos option then this will be the fixed address

typos-fixed.description: True if typos have been fixed

syntax-error.description: True if this address has a syntax error

domain-error.description: True if this address has a domain error (e.g. no valid mail server records)

is-freemail.description: True if this address is a free-mail address

is-disposable.description: True if this address is a disposable, temporary or darknet related email address

is-personal.description: True if this address is for a person. False if this is a role based address, e.g. admin@, help@, office@, etc.

smtp-status.description:
The SMTP verification status for the address:
  • ok - SMTP verification was successful, this is a real address that can receive mail
  • invalid - this is not a valid email address (has either a domain or syntax error)
  • absent - this address is not registered with the email service provider
  • unresponsive - the mail server(s) for this address timed-out or refused to open an SMTP connection
  • unknown - sorry, we could not reliably determine the real status of this address (this address may or may not exist)

smtp-response.description: The raw SMTP response message received during verification

is-catch-all.description: True if this email domain has a catch-all policy (it will accept mail for any username)

is-deferred.description: True if the mail server responded with a temporary failure (either a 4xx response code or unresponsive server). You can retry this address later, we recommend waiting at least 15 minutes before retrying

is-bot.description: IP is hosting a malicious bot or is part of a botnet. This is a broad category which includes brute-force crackers

is-exploit-bot.description: IP is hosting an exploit finding bot or is running exploit scanning software

is-malware.description: IP is involved in distributing or is running malware

is-spider.description: IP is running a hostile web spider / web crawler

is-dshield.description: IP has been flagged as a significant attack source by DShield (dshield.org)

list-count.description: The number of blocklists the IP is listed on

is-proxy.description: IP has been detected as an anonymous web proxy or anonymous HTTP proxy

is-hijacked.description: IP is part of a hijacked netblock or a netblock controlled by a criminal organization

is-tor.description: IP is a Tor node or running a Tor related service

is-spyware.description: IP is involved in distributing or is running spyware

is-spam-bot.description: IP address is hosting a spam bot, comment spamming or any other spamming type software

is-listed.description: Is this IP on a blocklist

is-vpn.description: IP belongs to a public VPN provider (only set if the 'vpn-lookup' option is enabled)

last-seen.description: The unix time when this IP was last seen on any blocklist. IPs are automatically removed after 7 days therefor this value will never be older than 7 days

blocklists.description: An array of strings indicating which blocklist categories this IP is listed on

sensors.description: An array of objects containing details on which specific sensors detected the IP

cidr.description: The CIDR address for this listing (only set if the IP is listed)

api-error.description: API error code. If set and > 0 then an API error has occurred your request could not be completed

found.description: The number of possible matching locations found

valid.description: True if this is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address

hostname.description: The IPs full hostname (only set if reverse-lookup has been used)

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

host-domain.description: The IPs host domain (only set if reverse-lookup has been used)

is-v6.description: True if this is a IPv6 address. False if IPv4

is-v4-mapped.description: True if this is a IPv4 mapped IPv6 address

is-bogon.description: True if this is a bogon IP address such as a private network, local network or reserved address

content.description: The complete raw, decompressed and decoded page content. Usually will be either HTML, JSON or XML

is-error.description: True if an error has occurred loading the page. Check the 'error-message' field for details

is-timeout.description: True if a timeout occurred while loading the page. You can set the timeout with the request parameter 'timeout'

error-message.description: Contains the error message if an error has occurred ('is-error' will be true)

http-status-code.description: The HTTP status code the URL returned

http-status-message.description: The HTTP status message the URL returned

is-http-ok.description: True if the HTTP status is OK (200)

is-http-redirect.description: True if the URL responded with an HTTP redirect

http-redirect-url.description: The redirected URL if the URL responded with an HTTP redirect

load-time.description: The number of seconds taken to load the page (from initial request until DOM ready)

response-headers.description: Map containing all the HTTP response headers the URL responded with

is-secure.description: True if the page is secured using TLS/SSL

security-details.description: Map containing details of the TLS/SSL setup

elements.description:
Array containing all the elements matching the supplied selector.
Each element object will contain the text content, HTML content and all current element attributes

exec-results.description: If you executed any JavaScript this array holds the results as objects

language-code.description: The ISO 2-letter language code of the page. Extracted from either the HTML document or via HTTP headers

number-valid.description: True if this a valid phone number

security-code.description: The security code generated, you can save this code to perform your own verification or you can use the Verify Security Code API

sent.description: True if the SMS has been sent

valid.description: True if the conversion was successful and produced a valid result

result.description: The result of the conversion in string format

from-type.description: The type of the value being converted from

result-float.description: The result of the conversion as a floating-point number

number-valid.description: True if this a valid phone number

mnc.description: The mobile MNC number (Mobile Network Code)

number-type.description:
The number type, possible values are:
  • mobile
  • fixed-line
  • premium-rate
  • toll-free
  • voip
  • unknown

hlr-valid.description: Was the HLR lookup successful. If true then this is a working and registered cell-phone or mobile device (SMS and phone calls will be delivered)

hlr-status.description:
The HLR lookup status, possible values are:
  • ok - the HLR lookup was successful and the device is connected
  • absent - the number was once registered but the device has been switched off or out of network range for some time
  • unknown - the number is not known by the mobile network
  • invalid - the number is not a valid mobile MSISDN number
  • fixed-line - the number is a registered fixed-line not mobile
  • voip - the number has been detected as a VOIP line
  • failed - the HLR lookup has failed, we could not determine the real status of this number

ported-network.description: The ported to network/carrier name (only set if the number has been ported)

imsi.description: The mobile IMSI number (International Mobile Subscriber Identity)

mcc.description: The mobile MCC number (Mobile Country Code)

international-number.description: The number represented in full international format

local-number.description: The number represented in local dialing format

country-code.description: The number location as an ISO 2-letter country code

is-ported.description: Has this number been ported to another network

msin.description: The mobile MSIN number (Mobile Subscription Identification Number)

location.description: The number location. Could be a city, region or country depending on the type of number

is-mobile.description: True if this is a mobile number (only true with 100% certainty, if the number type is unknown this value will be false)

is-roaming.description: Is this number currently roaming from its origin country

country-code3.description: The number location as an ISO 3-letter country code

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

roaming-country-code.description: If the number is currently roaming, the ISO 2-letter country code of the roaming in country

msc.description: The mobile MSC number (Mobile Switching Center)

country.description: The full country name of the issuer

ip-city.description: The city of the customers IP (if detectable)

ip-matches-bin.description: True if the customers IP country matches the BIN country

card-type.description: The card type, will always be one of: DEBIT, CREDIT, CHARGE CARD

card-category.description: The card category. There are many different card categories the most common card categories are: CLASSIC, BUSINESS, CORPORATE, PLATINUM, PREPAID

ip-country-code.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the customers IP

ip-country.description: The country of the customers IP

ip-blocklisted.description: True if the customers IP is listed on one of our blocklists, see the IP Blocklist API

valid.description: Is this a valid BIN or IIN number

ip-blocklists.description: An array of strings indicating which blocklists this IP is listed on

country-code.description: The ISO 2-letter country code of the issuer

ip-region.description: The region of the customers IP (if detectable)

card-brand.description: The card brand (e.g. Visa or Mastercard)

country-code3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the issuer

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country of the issuer

ip-country-code3.description: The ISO 3-letter country code of the customers IP

is-commercial.description: Is this a commercial/business use card

is-prepaid.description: Is this a prepaid or prepaid reloadable card

valid.description: Is this a valid phone number

country-code.description: The phone number country as an ISO 2-letter country code

location.description: The phone number location. Could be the city, region or country depending on the type of number

is-mobile.description: True if this is a mobile number. If the number type is unknown this value will be false

type.description:
The number type based on the number prefix.
Possible values are:
  • mobile
  • fixed-line
  • premium-rate
  • toll-free
  • voip
  • unknown (use HLR lookup)

international-number.description: The number represented in full international format (E.164)

local-number.description: The number represented in local dialing format

country-code3.description: The phone number country as an ISO 3-letter country code

currency-code.description: ISO 4217 currency code associated with the country

prefix-network.description: The network/carrier who owns the prefix (this only works for some countries, use HLR lookup for global network detection)

domain.description: The primary domain name excluding any subdomains. This is also referred to as the second-level domain (SLD)

is-malicious.description: Consider this domain malicious as it is currently listed on at least 1 blocklist

blocklists.description: An array of strings indicating which blocklist categories this domain is listed on. Current categories are: phishing, malware, spam, anonymizer, nefarious

sensors.description: An array of objects containing details on which specific blocklist sensors have detected this domain

valid.description: True if a valid domain was found. For a domain to be considered valid it must be registered and have valid DNS NS records

is-subdomain.description: Is the FQDN a subdomain of the primary domain

tld-cc.description: For a country code top-level domain (ccTLD) this will contain the associated ISO 2-letter country code

rank.description: The domains estimated global traffic rank with the highest rank being 1. A value of 0 indicates the domain is currently ranked outside of the top 1M of domains

is-gov.description: Is this domain under a government or military TLD

is-opennic.description: Is this domain under an OpenNIC TLD

is-pending.description: True if this domain is unseen and is currently being processed in the background. This field only matters when the 'live' lookup setting has been explicitly disabled and indicates that not all domain data my be present yet

is-adult.description: This domain is hosting adult content such as porn, webcams, escorts, etc

registered-date.description: The ISO date this domain was registered or first seen on the internet. An empty value indicates we could not reliably determine the date

age.description: The number of days since the domain was registered. A domain age of under 90 days is generally considered to be potentially risky. A value of 0 indicates no registration date was found for this domain

registrar-name.description: The name of the domain registrar owning this domain

registrar-id.description: The IANA registrar ID (0 if no registrar ID was found)

dns-provider.description: The primary domain of the DNS provider for this domain

mail-provider.description: The primary domain of the email provider for this domain. An empty value indicates the domain has no valid MX records
